intro: Licaria triandra, commonly known as the African rose or African hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Licaria triandra thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
